clinical_study.brief_title: Structural and Functional Repercussions of Pulmonary Tuberculosis Sequelae
clinical_study.official_title: Structural and Functional Repercussions of Pulmonary Tuberculosis Sequelae

brief_summary.textblock: The study assesses patients with cured pulmonary tuberculosis by compulsory notification data of Uberlândia (Minas Gerais state - Brazil) from 2013, 2014 and 2015. These patients will be randomly selected and invited by telephonic contact. After eligibility and exclusion criteria evaluation, those included will be assessed in order to know structural and functional repercussions of pulmonary tuberculosis sequelae.

detailed_description.textblock: This study evaluates structural and functional repercussions of pulmonary tuberculosis sequelae by chest imaging (computed tomography and radiograph), functional respiratory tests (spirometry, plethysmography, diffusing capacity for carbon monoxide and cardiopulmonary exercise testing) in patients with cured pulmonary tuberculosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between extent of pulmonary disease by computed tomography and lung volumes by spirometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least one year after completion of the tuberculosis treatment
primary_outcome.description: High resolution computed tomography of the lungs will be evaluated by radiologists and the extent of pulmonary abnormalities will be score subjectively. Spirometry will permit assessment of lung volumes: forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) and forced vital capacity (FVC).

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between extent of pulmonary disease by computed tomography and lung volumes by plethysmography
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least one year after completion of the tuberculosis treatment
primary_outcome.description: High resolution computed tomography of the lungs will be evaluated by radiologists and the extent of pulmonary abnormalities will be score subjectively. Plethysmography will permit assessment of static lung volumes: residual volume (RV) and total lung capacity (TLC).
